newsitem.title: IRAQ: Iraq exports 10 mln barrels of oil via Gulf - paper.
newsitem.headline: Iraq exports 10 mln barrels of oil via Gulf - paper.

text.p: Iraq has exported a total of 10.1 million barrels of crude oil through its Gulf oil terminal since starting limited oil exports in mid-December, the ruling Baath party newspaper al-Thawra said on Thursday.
"The total amount of oil exported via Mina al-Bakr terminal has reached since mid December 10,100,000 barrels," the paper said.

Iraq began limited oil sales on December 10 under an agreement signed with the United Nations. The deal allowed Baghdad to sell $2 billion worth of oil every six months to buy food and medicines for the Iraqi people, suffering from stringent U.N. sanctions imposed after Iraq's invasion of Kuwait in August 1990.
The bulk of Iraq's oil exports, around 650,000 barrels per day (bpd), is pumped to international markets via Turkey and the remainder through its Gulf terminal.
On Tuesday, a senior Iraqi oil official said Baghdad was planning to expand its oil pipeline links with its neighbours in order to increase its oil export capacity.
Prior to the U.N. sanctions, Iraq exported more than 2.5 million bpd.
